title: TV Vision Limited
summary: TV Vision Limited has informed the Exchange regarding '1. Based on the recommendation of Nomination and Remuneration Committee, the Board of Directors approved the re-appointment of Mr. Pritesh Rajgor (DIN: 07237198) as an Independent Director of the Company for a term of 5...
fullContent: TV Vision Limited has informed the Exchange regarding '1. Based on the recommendation of Nomination and Remuneration Committee, the Board of Directors approved the re-appointment of Mr. Pritesh Rajgor (DIN: 07237198) as an Independent Director of the Company for a term of 5 (Five) consecutive years w.e.f. 24th November, 2025 upto 23rd November, 2030, subject to approval of members in their meeting.2. Based on the recommendation of Audit Committee the Board of Directors approved the appointment of M/S. HRU & Associates, Practicing Company Secretary, as the Secretarial Auditors of the Company for the term of 5 (five) consecutive years commencing from the financial year 2025-2026 and till the conclusion of the financial year 2029-2030, subject to approval of members in their meeting.3. Shifting of Registered Office of the Company from 4th Floor, Adhikari Chambers, Oberoi Complex, New Link Road, Andheri (W), Mumbai- 400 053 to 7th Floor, Adhikari Chambers, Oberoi Complex, New Link Road, Andheri (W), Mumbai 400 053 with immediate effect.'. |SUBJECT: Updates

title: Gordon Brown Urges Reeves to Exclude Defense From UK Budget Rule
summary: Former Prime Minister Gordon Brown said “exceptional” UK defense spending to counter the threat of Russia should be exempt from the government’s fiscal rules, a move that would free up billions of pounds for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ahead of a difficult budget...
fullContent: Former Prime Minister Gordon Brown said “exceptional” UK defense spending to counter the threat of Russia should be exempt from the government’s fiscal rules, a move that would free up billions of pounds for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves ahead of a difficult budget in the autumn.

title: Airtel promoters to sell shares worth over Rs 9,000 crore in block deal
summary: Bharti Airtel's promoters, through Indian Continent Investment, plan to sell shares worth up to Rs 9,310 crore via a block deal, representing 0.8% of the company's equity. The floor price is set at Rs 1,862 per share, a 3.15% discount.
fullContent: Bharti Airtel's promoters, through Indian Continent Investment, plan to sell shares worth up to Rs 9,310 crore via a block deal, representing 0.8% of the company's equity. The floor price is set at Rs 1,862 per share, a 3.15% discount. Jefferies and JPMorgan are managing the deal, expected to draw strong institutional interest despite potential near-term stock pressure.

title: Stagflation Is Hitting Russia’s War Economy
summary: Heading into the fall, Russia’s financial reserves are running out, its energy revenues are declining, and there are increasingly severe shortages of labor and imported technology. Slowly but surely, Vladimir Putin’s war and the effects of Western sanctions are taking their...
fullContent: Heading into the fall, Russia’s financial reserves are running out, its energy revenues are declining, and there are increasingly severe shortages of labor and imported technology. Slowly but surely, Vladimir Putin’s war and the effects of Western sanctions are taking their toll on economic growth and price stability.
